channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights on this section of Evesham Road are all broken again!, 1st May
item.description:
The street lights on this section of Evesham Road between the two sets of traffic lights are down AGAIN and have been off for weeks now. This happened for most of last year too. They need to be fixed properly this time. The street is dangerously dark at night with pedestrians walking into each other on the way home from town.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 13 Evesham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of rubbish left outside, 1st May
item.description:
Every two weeks number 9 leave bags of rubbish all over the pavement in preparation for bin day, which then get torn open by animals and spread all over the road and pavement and creates a unhygienic and smelly environment

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 9 Saint Paul's Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes, 1st May
item.description:
A lot of potholes on the road along this stretch of road, require going into the over lane to dodge them
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 143 Orchard Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes on road, 1st May
item.description:
The section of road coming from the train station to the traffic lights is appalling. There are multiple potholes everywhere along this stretch making all cars swerve to miss them or risk damaging their car. They’ve previously been filled but are already damaged, whole road needs resurfacing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 216 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Corsa on road, 30th April
item.description:
This car has been abandoned here for over six months. It has multiple flat tires, mould and trash inside the car and a big dent at the rear. It is parked right by the entrance to the apartments on Kings Road, just behind the white line, on the left hand side of the road when coming from Hales Road direction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 King's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
